intro: Brachystelma nanum, commonly known as the dwarf star of the desert, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pale yellow or white, appearing in late summer. Due to its compact size and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
